interpolation.title: Interpolation
interpolation.intro: Interpolation is about injecting runtime values into translation messages.
interpolation.help: Change the first name and last name values to see them interpolated into the translated strings. Try this in different languages by using the language switcher in the top bar.

plurals.title: Plurals
plurals.intro: Different languages have different plural rules (not just singular | plural). i18next uses the standard Intl.PluralRules object for localized pluralization.
plurals.help: Change the count to see the various plural forms for the selected language. Try this in different languages.
plurals.trees_grown_zero: We have not grown any trees yet
plurals.trees_grown_one: We have grown one tree ðŸŒ³
plurals.trees_grown_other: We have grown {{count, number}} trees ðŸŒ³

numbers.title: Numbers
numbers.intro: i18next uses the standard Intl.NumberFormat object for localized number formatting.
numbers.help: Change the number to see it formatted in different ways. Try this in different languages.
numbers.percent: Percentage (use values between 0 and 1): {{value, number(style: percent)}}
numbers.standalone_help: These aren't embedded in a translation message. They use Intl.NumberFormat directly and are output into the component JSX without going through i18next.

dates.title: Dates
dates.intro: i18next uses the standard Intl.DateTimeFormat object for localized date formatting.
dates.help: Change the date to see it formatted in different ways. Try this in different languages.
dates.custom: Custom date format: {{value, datetime(weekday: long; year: 2-digit; month: short; day: numeric)}}
dates.standalone_help: These aren't embedded in a translation message. They use Intl.DateTimeFormat directly and are output into the component JSX without going through i18next.
